metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the Shenshawo desert station eddy covariance system (EC) in the middle reaches of the Heihe hydrometeorological observation network from 15 September, 2012, to 31 December, 2013. The site (100.493° E, 38.789° N) was located in the desert surface, near Zhangye city in Gansu Province. The elevation is 1594 m. The EC was installed at a height of 4.6 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500) was 0.15 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Edire post-processing software (University of Edinburgh, http://www.geos.ed.ac.uk/abs/research/micromet/EdiRe/), including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), as proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), which represent high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened using a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data collected before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Suspicious data were marked in red. The 10 Hz data were missing during 8 December to 22 December, 2012, and data in this period were replaced with 30 min flux output by data logger. Data during 25 May to 29 May, 2013 were missing due to calibration of CO2/H2O gas analyzer.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. 
For more information, please refer to Li et al. (2013) (for hydrometeorological observation network or sites information), Liu et al. (2011) (for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2012年9月15日至2013年12月31日的黑河水文气象观测网中游神沙窝沙漠站的涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市，下垫面是沙漠。观测点的经纬度是100.49330E, 38.78917N，海拔1594.00m。涡动相关仪的架高4.6m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是15cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识，其中2012年12月8日-12月22日由于10Hz数据缺失，由采集器输出的30min通量数据替代；2013年5月25-5月29日CO2/H2O分析仪标定，数据缺失。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Li et al. (2013)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型包含所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层），并与使用波 Bowen 比率-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果进行了比较。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观测比率。
这封信的目的是利用通过高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，估算蒸散发（E）、土壤温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡动相关（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下对冠层温度的高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米高度的空气温度、风速、湿度，12米高度使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高度测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天07:00至19:00期间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，采用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组分温度是通过热像仪获得的图像计算得出的。为了计算组分温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中的蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）的比率，该实验是河西水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区大约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with the collection of multiscale observations in oasis-desert systems?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，收集多尺度观测数据面临哪些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting multiscale observations in oasis-desert systems include the poor availability of data over different spatial and temporal scales. This complexity requires a hierarchical and nested instrumentation approach to capture the diverse eco-hydrological processes, which involves deploying various sensors and observation techniques across different landscapes within the oasis-desert ecosystem.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度观测数据的挑战包括在不同空间和时间尺度上数据的可用性较差。这种复杂性要求采用分层和嵌套的仪器方法，以捕捉多样的生态水文过程，这涉及在绿洲-沙漠生态系统内的不同景观中部署各种传感器和观测技术。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the data processing and quality control procedure of eddy covariance systems in oasis-desert areas compare to those used in irrigated agricultural regions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，涡度协方差系统的数据处理和质量控制程序与灌溉农业区域使用的程序相比，有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In oasis-desert areas, data processing and quality control involve acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data with eddy covariance systems and implementing a procedure divided into data collection, processing, and archiving. In contrast, in irrigated agricultural regions, eddy covariance systems are used in conjunction with ground measurements for validation and partitioning of evapotranspiration, with a focus on addressing uncertainties in component temperature estimations and environmental factors like strong advection.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，数据处理和质量控制涉及使用涡度协方差系统获取半小时的湍流通量数据，并实施一个分为数据收集、处理和归档的程序。相比之下，在灌溉农业地区，涡度协方差系统与地面测量结合使用，以进行验证和蒸散发的分配，重点解决成分温度估算和强平流等环境因素的不确定性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the similarities and differences between the instrumentation used in the oasis-desert system for capturing eco-hydrological processes and the eddy covariance systems used for estimating evapotranspiration in agricultural areas?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统的生态水文过程和用于估算农业地区蒸散发的涡度协方差系统中，所使用的仪器的相似性和差异性是什么？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Both the oasis-desert systems and agricultural areas use eddy covariance systems to measure turbulent fluxes. The oasis-desert system instrumentation is arranged in hierarchically nested scales with additional equipment like large aperture scintillometers and automatic meteorological stations to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. In contrast, agricultural areas focus on using eddy covariance systems along with thermal cameras to obtain soil and canopy temperatures for evapotranspiration estimation.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠系统和农业区域都使用涡动协方差系统来测量湍流通量。绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器以层次嵌套的方式布置，并配备了大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。相比之下，农业区域则侧重于使用涡动协方差系统以及热成像相机来获取土壤和冠层温度，以估算蒸散发。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How does the methodology for assessing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas compare to the methods used for evaluating soil and canopy component temperatures in agricultural regions?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 评估绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换的方法与评估农业地区土壤和冠层组分温度的方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In oasis-desert areas, the assessment of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange involves long-term observations using eddy covariance systems, automatic weather stations, and scintillometers, supplemented by data on vegetation and soil parameters. In agricultural regions, the evaluation of soil and canopy component temperatures is achieved using thermal cameras and involves partitioning evapotranspiration into separate components, validated by eddy covariance system measurements and stable isotope techniques.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，能量、水汽和碳交换的评估涉及使用涡度协方差系统、自动气象站和闪烁仪进行长期观测，并辅以植被和土壤参数的数据。在农业地区，土壤和冠层组分温度的评估是通过热像仪实现的，并涉及将蒸散发分成不同的组分，这些组分通过涡度协方差系统测量和稳定同位素技术进行验证。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges of estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，估算表面通量面临的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure in eddy covariance (EC) flux measurements and the uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences. These uncertainties are often caused by errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，这主要是由于涡度协方差（EC）通量测量中的能量平衡闭合不完全以及表面与空气温度差异的不确定性。这些不确定性通常是由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度时的误差所导致的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a limitation in the effectiveness of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在干旱地区复合温度分离方法的有效性存在限制？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The limitation in the effectiveness of composite temperature separation approaches in arid regions arises from image classification errors that vary with vegetation abundance. These errors lead to an overestimation of canopy temperature, especially when soil pixels are misclassified as vegetation pixels. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can contribute to uncertainties in estimated temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，复合温度分离方法的有效性受到限制，主要是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这些错误导致冠层温度的过高估计，尤其是在土壤像素被误分类为植被像素时。此外，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率也会导致温度估计的不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the causes of poor availability of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上多尺度观测的可用性差的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The poor availability of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes is largely due to the complexity and heterogeneity of the surface, which requires a multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection approach. Challenges include obtaining comprehensive coverage and integrating data from various sources like eddy covariance towers, remote sensing instruments, and automatic meteorological stations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程中的多尺度观测可用性差，主要是由于地表的复杂性和异质性，这需要采用多尺度和多学科的数据收集方法。面临的挑战包括获得全面的覆盖以及整合来自不同来源的数据，如涡度协方差塔、遥感仪器和自动气象站。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using eddy covariance systems for measuring fluxes in heterogeneous landscapes with mixed soil and vegetation?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中使用涡度协方差系统测量混合土壤和植被的通量可能带来的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using eddy covariance systems in heterogeneous landscapes can lead to challenges in accurately estimating surface evapotranspiration due to mixed soil and vegetation components having different temperatures and resistances to energy exchange. These systems may face issues such as incomplete energy balance closure and uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences, affecting the accuracy of flux measurements.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中使用涡度协方差系统可能会导致准确估计表面蒸散发的挑战，因为混合的土壤和植被成分具有不同的温度和能量交换阻力。这些系统可能面临能量平衡闭合不完全和表面-空气温差的不确定性，从而影响通量测量的准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the lack of multiscale observations impact the effectiveness of eco-hydrological process upscaling on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 缺乏多尺度观测可能会如何影响在异质表面上生态水文过程上尺度的有效性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The lack of multiscale observations can hinder progress in eco-hydrological process upscaling on heterogeneous surfaces by limiting the ability to capture detailed interactions and processes across different scales. This can affect the understanding of oasis-desert interactions and impede efforts to achieve sustainable development and ecological stability in these regions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 缺乏多尺度观测会阻碍生态水文过程在异质表面上的上尺度进展，因为这限制了捕捉不同尺度之间详细相互作用和过程的能力。这可能影响对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的理解，并妨碍在这些地区实现可持续发展和生态稳定的努力。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What outcomes could result from implementing multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection techniques in oasis-desert areas?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区实施多尺度和多学科数据收集技术可能会产生哪些结果？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing multiscale and multidisciplinary data collection techniques in oasis-desert areas can lead to improved understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in these ecosystems. It allows for capturing detailed eco-hydrological processes, supporting sustainable oasis development, and contributing to ecological security and socioeconomic development. Such comprehensive data collection can also enhance the ability to address environmental degradation and climate change impacts.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区实施多尺度和多学科的数据收集技术，可以更好地理解这些生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换。这有助于捕捉详细的生态水文过程，支持可持续的绿洲发展，并促进生态安全和社会经济发展。这种全面的数据收集还可以增强应对环境退化和气候变化影响的能力。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to utilize high-resolution thermal cameras for estimating evapotranspiration components in agricultural settings?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在农业环境中，利用高分辨率热成像相机估算蒸散发成分的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: High-resolution thermal cameras are important for accurately estimating soil and canopy component temperatures, which are crucial for separating and validating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration components. This approach helps improve the accuracy of the two-source energy balance model, especially in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, thereby enhancing water resource management and understanding of the terrestrial water cycle.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热像仪对于准确估计土壤和冠层成分的温度至关重要，这对于分离和验证蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发成分非常重要。这种方法有助于提高双源能量平衡模型的准确性，特别是在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，从而增强水资源管理和对陆地水循环的理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the goal of maintaining long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期观察能量、水蒸气和碳通量的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal of maintaining long-term observations is to achieve sustainable oasis development by understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. This understanding supports ecological security, carbon peaking, and carbon neutrality in the oasis-desert area, thereby contributing to the stability and sustainability of these unique ecosystems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 维护长期观测的目标是通过了解能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，实现可持续的绿洲发展。这种理解支持生态安全、碳达峰和碳中和在绿洲-沙漠地区的实现，从而有助于这些独特生态系统的稳定性和可持续性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are employed to process eddy covariance data for use in hydrometeorological studies within arid environments?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在干旱环境中，处理涡度协方差数据以用于水文气象研究的程序包括哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance data processing involves several steps including outlier removal, time delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. Quality evaluation of flux values is conducted based on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics. Specific criteria include data rejection due to instrument errors, precipitation, high data loss, and weak turbulence at night.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差数据处理涉及多个步骤，包括异常值去除、时间延迟修正、坐标旋转、频率响应修正、虚拟温度修正和密度（WPL）修正。基于大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征，对通量值进行质量评估。具体标准包括因仪器错误、降水、高数据丢失和夜间湍流弱而导致的数据拒绝。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the accurate separation of soil and canopy component temperatures in remote sensing data collection for eco-hydrological studies?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在遥感数据收集中的土壤和冠层温度的准确分离成为可能，以便进行生态水文研究？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of high-resolution thermal infrared cameras allows for the accurate measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures, which are crucial for estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration. These cameras provide detailed thermal images that can be used to extract directional brightness temperatures and convert them into radiometric temperatures, enhancing the accuracy of surface flux estimations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热红外相机的使用可以准确测量土壤和冠层成分的温度，这对于估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散非常重要。这些相机提供详细的热成像，可以用来提取方向性亮度温度并将其转换为辐射温度，从而提高表面通量估算的准确性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might researchers encounter when collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems, and how can these challenges be addressed?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 研究人员在收集绿洲-沙漠系统中的多尺度生态水文数据时可能会遇到哪些挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Researchers face challenges such as the poor availability of multiscale observations and the complexity of upscaling data from heterogeneous surfaces. These challenges can be addressed by implementing hierarchically nested instrumentation scales, utilizing a combination of ground-based observations and remote sensing techniques, and conducting continuous monitoring through intensive observation periods.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 研究人员面临的挑战包括多尺度观测的可用性差以及从异质表面进行数据上升的复杂性。这些挑战可以通过实施分层嵌套的仪器尺度、结合地面观测和遥感技术，以及通过密集观测期进行持续监测来解决。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might it be difficult to achieve energy balance closure in eddy covariance measurements in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, and what strategies could be employed to improve data reliability?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区的涡度相关测量中，为什么可能难以实现能量平衡闭合，以及可以采用哪些策略来提高数据可靠性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Achieving energy balance closure in eddy covariance measurements is difficult due to factors like incomplete energy balance closure with available energy and errors in temperature difference estimations. Strategies to improve data reliability include accurate calculation of soil and vegetation component temperatures, using robust thermal imaging techniques, and refining the TSEB model to account for advective conditions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在涡度协方差测量中，实现能量平衡闭合是困难的，这主要由于可用能量的不完全能量平衡和温度差估计中的误差。提高数据可靠性的策略包括准确计算土壤和植被组分的温度，使用可靠的热成像技术，以及改进TSEB模型以考虑平流条件。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the challenges associated with using thermal infrared cameras for measuring component temperatures in heterogeneous landscapes, and how might these affect data collection outcomes?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 使用热红外相机在异质景观中测量组件温度所面临的挑战有哪些，这些挑战可能如何影响数据收集结果？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges associated with using thermal infrared cameras in heterogeneous landscapes include image classification errors, which can lead to incorrect categorization of soil and vegetation pixels, potentially affecting canopy temperature estimates. Errors in atmospheric radiation and transmittance estimation can also introduce uncertainties. These challenges can affect the accuracy of data collection by leading to biases in temperature measurements, which are critical inputs for models estimating evapotranspiration and energy fluxes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在异质景观中使用热红外相机面临的挑战包括图像分类错误，这可能导致土壤和植被像素的错误分类，从而影响冠层温度估计。大气辐射和透射率估计中的错误也可能引入不确定性。这些挑战可能影响数据收集的准确性，导致温度测量的偏差，而温度测量是估算蒸散发和能量通量模型的重要输入。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways might multiscale datasets from oasis-desert systems provide insights into eco-hydrological processes, and what considerations should be made for their future expansion?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的多尺度数据集可能会在哪些方面为生态水文过程提供洞察？对于其未来扩展应考虑哪些因素？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Multiscale datasets from oasis-desert systems can offer valuable insights into the interactions between energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, crucial for understanding ecological stability and agricultural productivity. For future expansion, considerations should include enhancing the spatial and temporal resolution of observations, integrating additional parameters such as soil and vegetation characteristics, and improving data sharing platforms to facilitate broader research collaborations. Addressing challenges like data quality control and sensor calibration is also essential for maintaining the reliability of these datasets.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 来自绿洲-沙漠系统的多尺度数据集可以提供关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换之间相互作用的宝贵见解，这对于理解生态稳定性和农业生产力至关重要。未来扩展时，应考虑提高观测的空间和时间分辨率，整合土壤和植被特征等额外参数，并改善数据共享平台，以促进更广泛的研究合作。解决数据质量控制和传感器校准等挑战对于维护这些数据集的可靠性也至关重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data from eddy covariance systems can be processed for accuracy in such varied environmental conditions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何在如此多样的环境条件下处理涡度协方差系统的数据以确保准确性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Data from eddy covariance systems are processed using software like Edire, which involves steps such as outlier removal, delay time correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, virtual temperature correction, and density corrections. Quality evaluation is also performed focusing on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics. This ensures the data accuracy across different environmental conditions.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统的数据通过像Edire这样的软件进行处理，涉及的步骤包括异常值去除、延迟时间校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、虚拟温度校正和密度校正。同时还进行质量评估，重点关注大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征。这确保了在不同环境条件下数据的准确性。

Assertion.AnswerEn: Data from meteorological and hydrological stations, which include energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes along with auxiliary data like hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, are integrated through a structured data processing and quality control procedure. This involves collection, processing, archiving, and sharing to ensure a comprehensive understanding of oasis-desert systems.

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the data collection methods utilized for capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems, focusing on the instrumentation and observational approaches.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述用于捕捉绿洲-沙漠系统中多尺度生态水文过程的数据收集方法，重点关注仪器和观测方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out, with instruments arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. A sparse network was established to investigate the oasis-desert interaction, including a superstation, EC towers, and meteorological stations in different landscapes. Additionally, 12 airborne remote sensing missions using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers were conducted.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 进行了多个强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测，仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度布置，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用，包括一个超级站、生态系统（EC）塔和不同景观中的气象站。此外，还进行了12次航空遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and discuss any datasets available that pertain to energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert regions, and elaborate on their potential applications.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别并讨论与绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换相关的任何可用数据集，并阐述它们的潜在应用。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: A multiscale dataset from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area, including data from eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing tools, is available. These datasets can be applied to study eco-hydrological processes and support ecological security and sustainable development of oases.
